problem.title: CheckPoint: Yo-Yo
problem.script:
m=random.choice([0.12,0.25,0.8]) II=random.choice([0.064,0.096,0.12]) r=random.choice([0.02,0.03,0.035]) dd=random.choice([0.8,1.1,1.4])
v= r* math.sqrt(2* m* dd*9.8/( II+ m* r* r))
problem.p: A yo-yo has mass $m kg and rotational inertia $II kg m2 measured about an axis perpendicular to the screen and passing through its center of mass. A light thin string is wrapped around the central part of the yo-yo that has radius $r m. The string is attached to the ceiling as shown. The yo-yo is released from rest and begins to descend as the string unwraps.
Part 1. Describe the major energy transformation that takes place.

choice.name: foil5
choice.text: kinetic translational into kinetic rotational and gravitational potential

choice.name: foil6
choice.text: kinetic rotational into kinetic translational and gravitational potential

choice.name: foil7
choice.text: gravitational potential into kinetic translational and kinetic rotational

problem.p: Part 2. What is the relationship between the linear speed \(v\) of the center of mass of the yo-yo and its angular speed \(\omega\)?
Part 3. Use conservation of energy to find the linear speed of the yo-yo by the time it descended a distance $dd m. Use g = 9.8 m/s2.
